intro: Deuterocohnia haumanii, commonly known as the Chilean heath, is a member of the Ericaceae family and is native to the Andes Mountains of Chile. It is a low-growing evergreen shrub characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and dark green, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Deuterocohnia haumanii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in rock gardens or as a container plant.
